text: [Music]
my company now our goal is to decrease
the death rate of small businesses it
was about a year ago we started moving
down the path of looking at
containerization and kubernetes in order
to help us be able to run war clothes
that were distinct from one another but
yet could share a similar resource pool
and that was one of the primary reasons
of starting to look at cloud native
offerings I have a little bit of history
around different offerings in this space
you know kubernetes had a fair amount of
people gathering behind it you know to
help make that project successful and I
think another thing is that it was born
out of Google those two things and then
evaluating the other solutions the other
solutions tend to be fairly heavy-handed
the reason we decided to go with
kubernetes opposed to the other
solutions is these kubernetes gave us a
very simple way to be able to step into
an orchestration solution that fit our
needs at the time being but also the
extensibility of it allowed us to be
able to grow with it and be able to
build in more features and functionality
later on there there's quite a bit of
impact in a lot of various ways
I'd say primarily it has made it
drastically simpler for us to be able to
scale out and be able to handle much
much larger loads and a much simpler
process that I think is probably the
primary one the other piece that is
secondary but it's also pretty drastic
for us is the developer interfaces with
kubernetes with kubernetes it has become
simple enough that the developers can do
it all themselves
the CNC have helped perpetuate the
possibility and the future of kubernetes
and the other projects that are forming
underneath it kubernetes Prometheus and
envoy are all ones that we are actually
using the community is absolutely vital
being able to pass ideas around being
able to talk about a lot of the similar
challenges that we're all facing and
being able to just get help in the
future as far as product line escape is
concerned and roadmap for us is deaf
storage and also around service
machining so as we've grown into the
kubernetes landscape those two pieces
are starting to become very troublesome
for us and you can see that I think with
the community itself that there's a lot
of formation around service meshes and
around being able to natively support
storage I really like the landscape
moving for above all else is best to
just take one small piece at a time and
let that digest and then move on to the
next piece it's summing up our
experience with kubernetes is kind of
like peanut butter and jelly in a
sandwich kubernetes helped become the
jelly of our peanut butter sandwich
within containers
